components.description:
A burger with a beef patty, usually depicted on a sesame bun with cheese, lettuce, and tomato—making it a cheeseburger, though officially called Hamburger by Unicode.

Platforms stack the ingredients in various orders. Google previously placed the cheese under the patty, a "controversy" CEO Sundar Pichai addressed in 2018.
components.title: Hamburger

description:
A burger with a beef patty, usually depicted on a sesame bun with cheese, lettuce, and tomato—making it a cheeseburger, though officially called Hamburger by Unicode.

Platforms stack the ingredients in various orders. Google previously placed the cheese under the patty, a "controversy" CEO Sundar Pichai addressed in 2018.
title: Hamburger

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Food symbol
emoji_net_data.definition: A cheeseburger emoji, otherwise known as a burger.¬†Two buns, containing a meat patty, cheese, and sometimes lettuce or tomato. Hamburger was http://emojipedia.org/hamburger/
emoji_net_data.name: hamburger

bn:00087460v: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
To consume (something solid or semi-solid, usually food) by putting it into the mouth and swallowing it.

bn:00054026n: The edible flesh of animals, especially that of mammals.
Meat is the flesh of an animal which is eaten.
Meat is animal flesh that is eaten as food.
The flesh of an animal used as food.
The flesh of animals (including fishes and birds and snails) used as food

bn:00033741n: Inexpensive food (hamburgers or chicken or milkshakes) prepared and served quickly
A type of meal that is often pre-prepared and served quickly.
A type of meal that is often standardized, pre-prepared, and served quickly.
Type of meal that is often pre-prepared and served quickly.
Food prepared and served in a small amount of time
Fast food is the term given to food that is prepared and served very quickly, first popularized in the 1950s in the United States.

bn:00009566n: A hot sandwich consisting of a patty of cooked ground beef, in a sliced bun, sometimes also containing salad vegetables, condiments, or both.
A hot sandwich typically consisting of a patty of cooked ground beef placed inside a bun along with various vegetables and condiments.
A sandwich consisting of a fried cake of minced beef served on a bun, often with other ingredients
A hamburger is a sandwich consisting of one or more cooked patties of ground meat, usually beef, placed inside a sliced bun.
Sandwich consisting of one or more cooked patties of ground meat usually placed inside a sliced hamburger bun

bn:00018050n: A hamburger with melted cheese on it
A cheeseburger is a hamburger topped with cheese.
A hamburger sandwich containing cheese (usually one or more slices of processed cheese).
A hamburger cooked with a slice of cheese on top of it.

bn:00893302n: Burger King, often abbreviated as BK, is a global chain of hamburger fast food restaurants headquartered in unincorporated Miami-Dade County, Florida, United States.
Whose NYSE stock symbol is BKW
Global chain of hamburger fast food restaurants

bn:01826071n: Nickname for McDonald's, chain of fast-food restaurants.
A nickname of McDonald's hamburger chain.
The McDonald's Corporation is the world's largest chain of hamburger fast food restaurants, serving around 68 million customers daily in 119 countries across 35,000 outlets.
A chain of fast food restaurants
A widespread chain of fast food restaurants.
The McDonalds chain of fast food restaurants.
McDonald's (the chain of fast food restaurants).
